body:
> The Go GC does have the ability to manually deallocate blocks

Do you mean how you can choose to disable GC at runtime, and switch it back on at a later time?

I also understand the need for GC when it comes to avoiding such problems in Go, and I would gladly take GC over having to manually unmap memory I'm not longer using. This proposal is for those who aren't looking for that, and want to make use of every bit of performance they can.

Sure, Garbage Collection can improve, but then what's the point of allowing the disabling of it?
